message: So they picked up an Objective-C book, and spent 3 months, and built it out.
Players were playing every waking hour that they weren't at work, "so we thought, let's build a web-based version so they can play *at work*"
This is going to be interesting, most of the time people go the other way--from Flash to iPhone.
So they decided to build a game: Kingdoms at War
They started in 2008, by 2009 they decided they needed to showcase chat technology
They like building on iPhone more due to the tools
(Also they were both obsessed with Mafia Wars and other games)
"We optimized for speed. We tried to get things out as soon as possible, and as a result things weren't always polished."
There's a huge difference in mentalities for building on iPhone vs. building on Flash.
But deploying their iPhone apps on the app store is a nightmare, but with the Flash version they can just push things out very quickly
This is a cool graph she's showing, it breaks up what people are doing during their play session.
People tend to chat a lot more on the web version
Lots of good design tips here
